* Define pharmacy and pharmacy technician and its role

* Scope of a pharmacist and a pharmacy technician
* Traits of a successful pharmacy technician

## Interactive Study Flashcards

```{ojs}
//| echo: false

// Load the data
data = FileAttachment("flashcards.csv").csv({ typed: true })

// State
mutable index = 0
mutable flipped = false

// The Card UI
viewof card = {
  const container = html`<div style="perspective: 1000px; width: 450px; margin: 40px auto; cursor: pointer; height: 300px;">
    <div id="inner" style="position: relative; width: 100%; height: 100%; transition: transform 0.6s; transform-style: preserve-3d; border-radius: 15px; box-shadow: 0 8px 16px rgba(0,0,0,0.15); border: 1px solid #e0e0e0;">
      <div style="position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; backface-visibility: hidden; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; padding: 30px; background: white; border-radius: 15px; font-size: 1.4rem; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;">
        ${data[index].Question}
      </div>
      <div style="position: absolute; width: 100%; height: 100%; backface-visibility: hidden; transform: rotateY(180deg); display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; padding: 30px; background: #f8f9fa; border-radius: 15px; font-size: 1.1rem; text-align: center;">
        ${data[index].Answer}
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>`;

  container.onclick = () => {
    mutable flipped = !mutable flipped;
  };
  
  return container;
}

// Update the flip rotation based on the mutable state
updateFlip = {
  const inner = document.querySelector("#inner");
  if(inner) {
    inner.style.transform = flipped ? "rotateY(180deg)" : "rotateY(0deg)";
  }
}

// Controls
html`
  <div style="text-align: center;">
    <button style="padding: 10px 20px; border-radius: 20px; border: 1px solid #ccc; cursor: pointer;" 
      onclick=${() => { mutable index = (index - 1 + data.length) % data.length; mutable flipped = false; }}>← Previous</button>
    
    <span style="margin: 0 20px; font-weight: bold; font-family: sans-serif;">${index + 1} / ${data.length}</span>
    
    <button style="padding: 10px 20px; border-radius: 20px; border: 1px solid #ccc; cursor: pointer;" 
      onclick=${() => { mutable index = (index + 1) % data.length; mutable flipped = false; }}>Next →</button>
  </div>
`
```
